Identity Management

Role model
fields.System.Description:
Develop an approach for assigning roles to users for a particular entity (company, site, dealership, etc.).  Options include a few defined roles each containing a number of permissions, custom roles holding permissions, etc.

In addition, we need to determine the best place to store role information (the app? AAD?)

Preconditions

 

Success path

 

Alternate paths

 

Post conditions

 

Notes

fields.System.Title: Azure Active Directory approach
fields.System.Description:
Determine best approach for Azure AD.  AAD will hold both Toyota and Raymond users, but can be synced or manually created.  Further, we can use federation against ADFS or other system or authenticate directly against the cloud.

In addition, a decision must be made on using B2B or B2C for customer and dealer accounts.

Finally, we must understand the attributes will be stored in AAD, including the entity the user belongs to, roles, etc.

Preconditions

 

Success path

 

Alternate paths

 

Post conditions

 

Notes

fields.System.Title: Authentication approach
fields.System.Description:
Come up with approach for authentication for different classes of users:
  • Raymond/Toyota users
  • Large dealers
  • Small dealers
  • Large customers
  • Small customers
Options include:
  • Authentication against accounts with userid/password in the cloud
  • Federation against ADFS for Raymond/Toyota users
  • B2B accounts authenticating against large customers' AADs
Also, determine if/when MFA is required.

Preconditions

 

Success path

 

Alternate paths

 

Post conditions

 

Notes

fields.System.Title: Password reset approach
fields.System.Description: Design the approach for self-service and administrator initiated password reset.

fields.System.Title: Power BI integration approach
fields.System.Description: We need to design the approach where we ensure the selected AAD authentication approach can integrate with Power BI.  This will likely not be a huge issue if we go with Azure AD and B2B.  However, if go with AAD B2C, this may involve creating a corresponding AAD user on a per organization basis and using it to access PBI via an "impersonation service".

fields.System.Title: Core IoT
Cloud Gateway – Standup Azure IotHub and other Components
As a Super-Admin, I want to scale out IotHub instances, so that the load can be distributed evently
As IoTHub, I want to know the Routing rules, so that the messages can be routed as per the Routing-configuration
As an Super Admin, I want to setup Azure Components (IoTHub, Storage etc.) on the Azure Subscription, so that the Solution can be built on top of them
As IoTHub, I want to know the Capacity and Sizing of the Solution, so that I can handle the load accordingly
Cloud Gateway – Lift truck device data transformation / augmentation / normalization
Device Management – Forklift Configuration Data
Device Management – Wireless Network Configuration
Device Management – UX for Device Twin Management
Cloud Gateway
As a Device, I want to send messages to the IoTHub, so that the necessary information to be processed on the Cloud
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions
  1. Device should be provisioned
  2. Device status should be active
  3. Device should be capable of communicating with IoT hub (IoT Device SDK)
  4. Device is authenticated and connected with IoTHub
  5. Routing-config has to be configured based on the requirements for Raymond/TMHU devices (along with a default-Route)

Success path
  1. Device sends a message with the appropriate headers on a secure TCP channel using AMQP protocol
  2. IoTHub receives the message
  3. IotHub routes the message based on the headers and as per Routing-config to appropriate destination (EventHubs etc.)

Alternate paths

  1. Device has to reconnect and resend the message in case of Network connectivity issues
  2. If there is an error/exception in routing the message, the system would log an event for operations/trouble-shooting

Post conditions

Process-IoT Hub receives the message sent by the Device for further processing based on the business logic

Notes

Disaster Recovery scenarios will be covered in general as separate User-Stories

fields.System.Title: As IoTHub, I want to send messages to the device, so that the device can act upon them
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions
  1. Device should be provisioned.
  2. Device status should be active.
  3. Device should be capable of communicating with IoT Hub (IoT Device SDK).

Success path

 

  1. IoT Hub receives the C2D message.
  2. Device is authenticated and connected with IoT Hub.
  3. IoT Hub sends the message to Device.
  4. Device receives the message and acts upon it.

Alternate paths

 

  1. If Device is not connected to IoT Hub when IoT Hub received the C2D message for that Device, Device should receive the C2D message, if message TTL has not expired, as soon as it re-connects to IoT Hub.
  2. Device is not connected to IoT Hub when IoT Hub received the C2D message for that Device, Device should not receive the C2D message, if message TTL has expired, even after it re-connects to IoT Hub.

Post conditions

Device receives the C2D message and processes it.

Notes

Disaster Recovery scenarios will be covered in general as separate User-Stories

fields.System.Title: As a Device, I want to send messages to the Field-Gateway, so that the Field-Gateway can forward them to IoTHub for processing
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions

1.       Device should be provisioned

2.       Device status should be active

3.       Device should be capable of communicating with Field Gateway (deployed on premise in warehouse).

Success path
  1. Device sends a D2C message, with the appropriate headers on a secure TCP channel using AMQP protocol, to Field Gateway.
  2. Field Gateway receives the message.

Alternate paths

1.       Device has to reconnect and resend the message in case of Network connectivity issues.

2.       If there is an error/exception in sending the message, the Device would log an event for operations/trouble-shooting.

Post conditions

D2C message is received at the Field Gateway for further processing.

Notes

Disaster Recovery scenarios will be covered in general as separate User-Stories

fields.System.Title: As a Field-Gateway, I want to send messages to the Device, so that I can forward the messages from IoTHub to the respective Devices
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions
  1. Device should be provisioned
  2. Device status should be active
  3. Device should be capable of communicating with Field Gateway
  4. Field Gateway should be capable of communicating with IoT Hub.

Success path
  1. User / System sends the message for a device to IoT Hub.
  2. IoT Hub receives the C2D message.
  3. Device is authenticated and connected with IoT Hub through Field Gateway.
  4. Field Gateway receives C2D message from IoT Hub.
  5. Field Gateway sends the C2D message to Device.
  6.  Device receives the message and acts upon it.

Alternate paths

  1. User / System should be notified if there is network connectivity issue while trying to send the C2D message to IoT Hub.
  2. If Device was not connected with Field Gateway when IoT Hub received the message, Device should receive the C2D message (if message TTL is not expired) as soon as it connects to Field Gateway..

Post conditions

Device receives the C2D message and process it.

Notes

Disaster Recovery scenarios will be covered in general as separate User-Stories

fields.System.Title: As a Field-Gateway, I want to send messages to IoTHub, so that I can forward messages on behalf of a Device to IoTHub for processing
As Device, I want to authenticate myself with IoTHub, so that I can communicate securely with IoTHub
As IoTHub, I want to communicate with Custom Protocol Gateway (LHP/TMHU), so that I can send and receive messages to THMU devices thru the Custom PG (LHP/CalAmp)
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions
  1. IoT Hub has been deployed.
  2. Custom Protocol Gateway (LHP/THMU) has been deployed.
  3. Custom Protocol Gateway (LHP/THMU) can communicate with IoT Hub.

Success path
  1. Custom Protocol Gateway (LHP/THMU) can connect to IoT Hub using AMQP.

Alternate paths

  1. System should log error/exception in case of Network Connectivity issues.

Post conditions

IoT Hub can communicate with Custom Protocol Gateway (LHP/THMU).

Notes

Disaster Recovery scenarios will be covered in general as separate User-Stories

fields.System.Title: As a Customer, I want to be able to change the password, so that the security is not compromised
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions
  1. User is already registered and authorized within the solution
  2. User is logged in

Success path
  1. Click on "Change My Password" button under Profile settings
  2. Enter the current password in the Old Password field.
  3. Enter the new password in the New Password field.
  4. Enter the new password again in the Retype New Password field.
  5. Select the "Change Password" button to save the new password

Alternate paths

An appropriate message is displayed for the following extension paths

  1. Old Passsword is incorrect in #2
  2. New Password text and Re-typed Password text do not match in #3, #4
  3. New Password does not meet the validation rules/criteria in #3
  4. Network connectivity issues in #5

Post conditions

User's password is changed to the new one

Notes

Validation rules: 1-20 printable characters

fields.System.Title: As a Customer, I want to set up a custom automated report, so that I can see it every Monday morning at 6:00am
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions

1. User is registered and authorized within the solution

2. User is logged in to software


Success path

1. User accesses Reporting module within software

2. User accesses "Automated Report Scheduling" interface

3. User selects appropriate report

4. User sets reporting period to be "Weekly"

5. User sets report generation time to be Monday at 6:00 am


Alternate paths

An appropriate message is displayed for the following extension paths:

1. User does not have permissions to access the report in #3 

Post conditions

Automated report schedule created that sends a report Monday at 6:00 AM with data for the previous week. Users with appropriate access can log in and view all existing automated reports and who is receiving them in one view.

Notes

All users with the appropriate access will be able to take any default or created report and automate it. User will be able to select report, frequency, time period, date/time report will be sent, report format (csv, xls, xlsx, rtf, html, pdf, jpg, docx) report destination (email, ftp). Email subject, body, and recipients should be editable. Email recipients will not be required to be software users in order to receive automated reports. Reports that contain no data should not be triggered to send.

fields.System.Title: As a Customer, I want to view Vehicle Location History, so that I can view what locations is it visiting, how long it has stayed there for and how often (during a day)
Shift Management
As a Customer, I want to assign shift profile to a vehicle group, so that based on their hours of operations, I can view accurate utilization numbers.
Maintenance Management
As a Dealer, I want to create a preventative maintenance profile, so that I can assign them to vehicle model(s).
As a Customer, I want to conduct system maintenance and operations, so that I can trigger maintenance mode, handle maintenance at field gateways, handle truck telemetry.
As a Customer, I want to perform system exceptions/issues review/capacity review, so that I can review operational logs and identify rules to highlight exceptions/issues.
Impact Analysis
As a Customer, I want to perform impact calibration, so that only filtered impacts are sent by device to the software via instant alerts.
As a Supervisor, I want to reply to the impact alert email with picture of impact damage, so that I can link those pictures to the specific impact event.
Modular Services
As a Customer, I want to upgrade my service tire from basic to plus so that I can get additional features.
As a Customer, I want to place order with my dealer for service upgrade from basic to plus service tire.
As a Dealer, I want to upgrade Customer service tire from basic to plus so that customer can get additional features.
Data Management
As a System, I want to create customer software instance and assign correct dealer IDs to new customer site, so that Dealer can see telematics data from telematics enabled device.
As a Dealer, I want to be able to see all data from devices partnered to my location ID.
Fleet Management
As a Customer, I want to define performance metrics for fleet, so that I can view fleet metric data
As a Customer, I want to manage performance metric defination, so that I can update/delete the definitions as required
As a Customer, I want to add performance metric validation, so that I can validate performance of my fleet.
As a Customer, I want to view the metrics for my fleet, so that I can track the performance of my fleet.
As a Customer, I want to schedule and dispatch fleet, so that [???]
As a Customer, I want to find and select a fleet, so that [???]
As a Customer, I want to validate fleet's scheduling and dispatching, so that [???]
As a Customer, I want to see my fleet utilization, so that I can determine fleet productivity
As a Customer, I want to enhance my fleet productivity, so that I can better utilize my fleet
Dealer Management
As a Dealer, I want to grants access to another dealer for a customer site which is outside of my APR (area of primary responsibility), so that  another dealer can provide service to the customer.
As a Dealer, I want to log in and view customer data for a customer site on which I have been granted access by another dealer, so that I can provide service to the customer.
As a System, I want to provide a training portal with videos/articles, so that dealer can get information.
As a Dealer, I want to select topics on the training portal as per my questions, so that I can get information.
As an Administrator, I want to update training material on the training portal, so that Dealers and Customers can view updated material.
As a Dealer, I want to manage telematics data on behalf of my customer, so that [???]
Device Management
As a Dealer, I want to order new device, so that faulty device can be replaced
As a Dealer, I want to use replace device functionality in the asset module to enter replacement date, key hours, and new device serial #, so that [???]
As a System, I want to swap vehicle association with faulty device to the new device whenever Dealer enters device replacement data, so that [???]
As a Dealer, I want to cancel a device order, so that I don't receive a device that is no longer required.
As a System, I want to notify SAP to replace old device with new device keeping same contract period, so that [???]
As a Customer, I want to move my assets between the groups in bulk, so that [???]
As a Dealer, I want to associate / pair a device with the vehicle, so that vehicle can communicate with Cloud, so that the Device/Truck pairings are mirrored between the cloud software and SAP
As a Dealer, I want to associate / pair a device with an asset (factory), so that [???]
As a Dealer, I want to pair a device with an asset in the field, so that I can begin receiving telemetry data from the asset
fields.System.Description:
Preconditions

1. Dealer installs device on truck

2. Dealer makes note of install date, key hours, truck VIN, and device serial #

3. Dealer is registered and authorized within the solution

4. Dealer is logged in to cloud Admin Portal

 

Success path

1. Dealer "in-fleets" telematics device into software

2. Dealer enters truck information to pair truck to device (either individually or in a bulk import)

3. Software checks against SAP device master to ensure valid truck information is entered & no duplicates

4. Pairing is Successful


Alternate paths

An appropriate message is displayed for the following extension paths:

 

1. The file specified for bulk import does not exist or is not in the correct format in #2

2. If the truck information is not valid or is a duplicate in #3

 

Post conditions

Pairings will trigger a call to equipment master within SAP to verify and mirror the pairings. Cloud Platform should have real-time access to TMHU SAP Master data. Device/Truck pairings should always be mirrored between the cloud software and SAP Equipment Master

 

Notes

fields.System.Title: Data Visualizations (Power BI)
Web Portal - Reporting - Raymond
As a Customer/Dealer I should be able to see reporting Information about Impacts occurred and with what magnitude to identify driver patterns and training opportunities.
As a Customer/Dealer I should be able to see reporting Information about Fault Codes in the vehicle to reports active fault codes and enables timely and preventive maintenance.
As a Customer/Dealer I should be able to see reporting Utilization information with Key Hours, Motion Hours, Activity Hours, Idle Hours of vehicle to evaluate how much a vehicle is being used.
As a Customer/Dealer I should be able to see reporting Total Motion hours vs. Total Idle Hours. to get usage of vehicle representing Overutilization/under utilization within fleet together.
As a Customer/Dealer I should be able to see reporting Asset List to Tracks number of vehicles and hour meter readings.
